options.content:
graph LR
 subgraph h1 ["Host 1"]
 h1ip{{IP: DATAPLANEIPA - VLAN: VLANA}}
 h1e1(IFNAMEHOSTA)
 style h1e1 fill: #50C878
 end
h1e1 --------- sw1s1if
 subgraph sw1 ["Switch 1"]
 subgraph sw1s1 ["interface 1"]
 sw1s1vlan{{VLAN: SWITCHAINVLAN SWITCHAIF}}
 sw1s1if[NAMEIFSWITCHA]
 style sw1s1if fill: #50C878
 end
 subgraph sw1s2 ["interface 2"]
 sw1s2if[NAMEIFSWITCHB]
 sw1s2vlan{{VLAN: SWITCHAOUTVLAN SWITCHAIF}}
 style sw1s2if fill: #50C878
 end
 end
 style sw1 fill: #282828
 subgraph h2 ["Host 2"]
 h2ip2{{IP: DATAPLANEIPB - VLAN: VLANB}}
 h2e2(IFNAMEHOSTB)
 style h2e2 fill: #50C878
 end
 sw1s2if ---------  h2e2

panels.description: Switch Interfaces, MAC Address, MTU, and Operational State
panels.title: Switch 1 Information (VLAN included)
Switch 1 Flow Summary - Bandwidth Graph - Host 1 Facing Port
Switch 1 Flow Summary - Bandwidth Graph - Host 2 Facing Port

panels.description: Host 1 TCP In / Out Collected by Node Exporter

targets.legendFormat: InSegs - Segments received, including those received in error. This count includes segments received on currently established connections
OutSegs - Segments sent, including those on current connections but excluding those containing only retransmitted octets

panels.title: Host 1 TCP In / Out

panels.description: Host 2 TCP In / Out Collected by Node Exporter

targets.legendFormat: InSegs - Segments received, including those received in error. This count includes segments received on currently established connections
OutSegs - Segments sent, including those on current connections but excluding those containing only retransmitted octets

panels.title: Host 2 TCP In / Out

panels.description: Collected from the Node Exporter on Host 1

targets.legendFormat: ListenOverflows - Times the listen queue of a socket overflowed
ListenDrops - SYNs to LISTEN sockets ignored
TCPSynRetrans - SYN-SYN/ACK retransmits to break down retransmissions in SYN, fast/timeout retransmits
RetransSegs - Segments retransmitted - that is, the number of TCP segments transmitted containing one or more previously transmitted octets
InErrs - Segments received in error (e.g., bad TCP checksums)

panels.title: Host 1 TCP Errors

panels.description: Collected from the Node Exporter on Host 2

targets.legendFormat: ListenOverflows - Times the listen queue of a socket overflowed
ListenDrops - SYNs to LISTEN sockets ignored
TCPSynRetrans - SYN-SYN/ACK retransmits to break down retransmissions in SYN, fast/timeout retransmits
RetransSegs - Segments retransmitted - that is, the number of TCP segments transmitted containing one or more previously transmitted octets
InErrs - Segments received in error (e.g., bad TCP checksums)

panels.title: Host 2 TCP Errors

targets.legendFormat: CurrEstab - TCP connections for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE- WAIT
MaxConn - Limit on the total number of TCP connections the entity can support (Dinamic is "-1")
CurrEstab - TCP connections for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE- WAIT
MaxConn - Limit on the total number of TCP connections the entity can support (Dinamic is "-1")
ActiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state
PassiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state
ActiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state
PassiveOpens - TCP connections that have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state

targets.legendFormat: InMsgs -  Messages which the entity received. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpInErrors
OutMsgs - Messages which this entity attempted to send. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpOutErrors
InMsgs -  Messages which the entity received. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpInErrors
OutMsgs - Messages which this entity attempted to send. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpOutErrors
InErrors - Messages which the entity received but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.)
InErrors - Messages which the entity received but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.)
InErrors - UDP Datagrams that could not be delivered to an application
NoPorts - UDP Datagrams received on a port with no listener
InErrors Lite - UDPLite Datagrams that could not be delivered to an application
InErrors - UDP Datagrams that could not be delivered to an application
NoPorts - UDP Datagrams received on a port with no listener
InErrors Lite - UDPLite Datagrams that could not be delivered to an application
